I've played Overwatch and Overwatch 2, before it came to Steam.
You can not trust any announcements or any roadmaps.
Good features will be removed, put behind a paywall or broken in some other way.
Also the monetanization is downright predatory.
The core gameplay is still fun (I wonder for how long, until this part is ruined as well), but the package it comes in is just not worth it.
I recommend staying away from this crashing plane of a game.

[h1]A good game, but i miss the old times..[/h1]
First of all, I'm very happy that Overwatch is now available on Steam, because its my main gaming platform.
It's a pity that the artworks are disabled, but this area would only be full of +18 random internet pictures anyway. 
I really miss the old Overwatch times with the Lootboxes and free Heroes, but at least the gameplay stayed nearly the same, so I'll only rate the game for that.

In addition to all the negative things that are enough to read here, I will mention a few positive points:
- good multiplayer game
- big selection of Heroes
- playable with controller
- varied game modes

Overwatch 2 ruined the game, in my opinion. I bought the OG Overwatch ages ago. I stopped playing a good 4 years or so ago because the lootboxes were an unfortunately tempting gambling mechanic and I had spent more on those than I had on the game's upfront cost itself. That said, the base game was good.

It just feels.. awful now and I strongly dislike the shift in player count and how matchmaking is done. I strongly dislike the monetisation scheme and I despise that they shut down access to the original Overwatch and forced original players into the F2P sequel - so I don't play anymore. I won't be strong-armed into a worse version of a game that already had issues in the first place. I will not play a game from a company that steals a game I PAID for and gives me a dumpster fire as a consolation prize.

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore

æš´é›ªæˆ‘ä¸ç©ä½ æ¸¸æˆ ä½†æ˜¯æˆ‘æ“ä½ å¦ˆ æˆ‘æ“æ­»ä½ å¦ˆä¸ªå‚»é€¼ç©æ„æ“ä½ å¦ˆçš„å‚»é€¼ä½ å¦ˆæ­»äº†æ“ä½ å¦ˆçš„

Overwatch 2 falls flat as a sequel, offering little more than a reskinned version of its predecessor. The promised innovations are superficial at best, and the promised PvE mode is non existent, leaving players wondering if this cash grab was truly necessary. The game's lack of ambition and failure to address core issues make it a disappointing and forgettable addition to the franchise. Blizzard is dead, D4 already proved that also, the old crew who made their epic games are long gone from the company. Blizzard right now is nothing more than an empty shell for Activision to try and milk more money out of the people.
